{{cpp/title|tuple_size{{small|&lt;std::complex&gt;}}}}
{{cpp/numeric/complex/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=complex|since=c++26|
template&lt; class T &gt;
struct tuple_size&lt;std::complex&lt;T&gt;&gt;
    : std::integral_constant&lt;std::size_t, 2&gt; {};
}}

The partial specialization of {{ltt|cpp/utility/tuple_size|std::tuple_size}} for {{lc|std::complex}} provides a compile-time way to obtain the number of components of a {{tt|complex}}, which is always {{c|2}}, using tuple-like syntax. It is provided for structured binding support.

{{cpp/types/integral_constant/inherit2|the constant value 2|std::size_t}}

===Notes===
{{feature test macro|__cpp_lib_tuple_like|std=C++26|value=202311L|Add tuple protocol to {{lc|std::complex}}}}

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;complex&gt;

static_assert(std::tuple_size_v&lt;std::complex&lt;float&gt;&gt; == 2);

static_assert([]
{
    using namespace std::literals;
    auto [re, im] = -1.5 + 2.5i;
    return re == -1.5 &amp;&amp; im == 2.5;
}());

static_assert([]
{
    using namespace std::literals;
    auto z = std::complex&lt;double&gt;{};
    auto&amp; [re, im] = z;
    re = 1.0;
    im = 2.0;
    return z == 1.0 + 2.0i;
}());
 
int main() {}
}}
